title: Understanding Gas Behavior
text: When the temperature of a gas increases, think about what happens to the particles in terms of their speed and energy.

title: Kinetic Molecular Theory
text: According to the kinetic molecular theory, the temperature of a gas is directly related to the average kinetic energy of its molecules. Consider how this affects molecular motion.

title: Molecular Velocity
text: As the temperature of a gas increases, the molecules move faster. This is because their kinetic energy increases. How does this relate to molecular velocity?

title: Pressure and Volume
text: While temperature affects molecular velocity, consider whether it directly affects the pressure or volume of the gas without other conditions specified.

title: Final Consideration
text: Focus on the relationship between temperature and molecular velocity. This is the key aspect that is always true when the temperature of a gas rises.
